00007 BOOST_AUTO_TEST_CASE( simple1 )
00008 {
00009         ParallelNode* node = new ParallelNode();
00010         node->addChild(new FailureAfter(1));
00011         node->addChild(new FailureAfter(3));
00012         int dummy_agent = 0;
00013         for (int i = 0 ; i <2 ; i++)
00014         {
00015         node->init(&dummy_agent);
00016         BOOST_CHECK_EQUAL(node->execute(&dummy_agent),BT_RUNNING);
00017         BOOST_CHECK_EQUAL(node->execute(&dummy_agent),BT_RUNNING);
00018         BOOST_CHECK_EQUAL(node->execute(&dummy_agent),BT_RUNNING);
00019         BOOST_CHECK_EQUAL(node->execute(&dummy_agent),BT_FAILURE);
00020         }
00021         delete node;
00022 }
00023 
00024 BOOST_AUTO_TEST_CASE( simple2 )
00025 {
00026         ParallelNode* node = new ParallelNode();
00027         node->addChild(new FailureAfter(0));
00028         int dummy_agent = 0;
00029         node->init(&dummy_agent);
00030         BOOST_CHECK_EQUAL(node->execute(&dummy_agent),BT_FAILURE);
00031 
00032         delete node;
00033 }
00034 
00035 // as currently specified, the parallelnode will neither succeed nor fail in this situation
00036 // is this the best behavior?
00037 // seems like it should fail instead of being in limbo
00038 BOOST_AUTO_TEST_CASE( simple3 )
00039 {
00040         ParallelNode* node = new ParallelNode();

00042         node->addChild(new FailureAfter(1));

00044         int dummy_agent = 0;
